title: For Sale:  Springfield Armory Mil-Spec 1911 Parkerized NM serialized
postcontent:
I am selling an old NM serialized 1911 in 45ACP that I rescued not too long ago. I intended to turn it into a project gun, but because of new circumstances, I gotta let her go. 
I never got around to shooting her but the fire control group seems to be in excellent order. A few scuffs & nicks here and there but nothing that would compromise function. She has Pachmayr wood/rubber grips with the grooves. 
She has been retrofitted by her earlier owner with now faded Tritium sights and it seems that the staked front sight has started to loosen up (I was planning on having a new sight dovetailed in by SA's custom shop). 
Aside from that, she's a very nice gun and would make a great starting point for a custom project. 
Included with the pistol are a few parts I scavenged from a friend's parts box that I was thinking of putting into her; a 3-hole Videcki style aluminum trigger minus the overtravel stop, an unknown beavertail and a commander style hammer. 
Lastly I'm also tossing in a SERPA holster and 3 different mags; GI-style 7 rounder , Pro-Mag 8 rounder , and Chip McCormick Shooting star 8 rounder.





For the whole thing I'm asking $500 FTF in Vegas area at Metro PD substation of buyer's choosing.
No trades, I need the cash to buy the necessary parts to fix my car. 
I will only accept a USPS Money Order.

 the Russian Firearms manufacturer Baikal marketed various Makarov handguns in the United States under the IJ-70 model. this rifle only has a 100 round box of ammo run through it
it shoots excellent and is accurate. it has diopter sights that are pretty easy to get a good sight picture. put a good scope on it and it would be a tack driver.
if you would like a scope i have one that i used only one trip to the range, it is a norin 2x6x28 rifle scope with accessorie rails and a mill dot reticle that you can turn on a red light ill let it go for 140.00. if you buy it and the rifle ill let it go for 625.00

it is a really nice ar rifle in 22lr inexpensive to buy ammo and shoot all day long

if interested call

title: For Trade:  (TRADED!)German Nazi Trainer 22LR $275 Cash or $325 Trade
postcontent:
This is a very fine German Trainer Rifle from the Nazi war era. The barrel and receiver have eagles on them. No markings on the stock. The barrel says; Fluss - Stahl  Krupp - Essen and 22 Long Rifle. The receiver is marked: Prazision s Karbiner, Gustloff-Werke, Waffenwerke Suhl. This is the factory taken over by the Nazi's from a Jewish owner. Very fine rifle and accurate out to 100+ yards. The adjustable rear sight starts at 100 yards and is adjustable to further distances. I can hit a 6" steel plate at 100 yards using plinker ammo all day long with this rifle. Similar, non-paddle bolt models have recently sold on gunbroker for $300 plus shipping. The paddle bolt is harder to find. I've taken 19 pictures and will email additional pictures to those interested. Looking to trade as opposed to selling out right. Thanks for looking! 

$275 cash or $325 Trade Value

title: For Sale:  Last day! SKS Bullpup-SGWorks stock, Takes AK Mags, Green laser/light & Tac-scope
postcontent:
Last day available! Listed on Gunbroker.com-ends Sunday afternoon! Get er now or good-bye! Just add ammo and this rifle is ready to roll! SGWorks-U.S.A. Made Bullpup stock assembly with SKS rifle/innards that are a type M Norinco Sporter. Great thing about these type M paratrooper size rifles are that they take AK Magazines (comes with a 20 round metal tanker mag and a 30 round standard Pro-mag for 922 compliance). Rifle length is 26.5 inches from butt-stock to barrel tip, and around 29" at end of flash-suppressor from butt. The SGWorks stock is the newest in the land, supposedly these have been on back-order for over a year or two due to high-demand (Cannot find another built set for sale on Gunbroker.com or anywhere else). The stock has a flat top rail for whatever picatinny/weaver optics/sights you want to mount. Included in sale is a Target Sports 4X32 tactical scope (new with box, caps & paperwork) with a P4 reticle (Bullet drop style) and it has the factory picatinny rails on the top and sides (of scope) to mount red/green dots/halos, lasers, lights, etc. Also included for the buyer is a Tri-Tac GL3X with a 5mw Green Laser (brightest allowed by law) with a main LED light that puts out 170+ Lumens and a single LED light on the side for use as stealth-mode only light. Laser/light combo is trigger activated (as seen on fore-grip handle) with a main switch to mix it up for laser-light, light only or laser only, multiple combos. This GL3X uses 2 CR123 batteries and they come with it. More on the rifle: SGWorks.com has videos and information on the Stock set. The gunsmith who built set for me had to use epoxy on a couple of the Allen bolts as the brass studs spun on the synthetic stock (Minor cosmetic issue, but note worthy). The bottom of the stock handle assembly has been ground/filed down so the 20 & 30 round AK magazines will fit into bottom of receiver properly. Again, these are cosmetics only, but I am doing my best to share all information regarding this gem so there are no surprises for buyer or seller. 
922 compliance/converted parts consist of: 1. Ramline-US made Muzzle brake/Attachment 2. US Made piston extension 3. US Made Gas Piston--Parts 4-9 covered by US made Bullpup stock set: Trigger housing, trigger, buttstock, pistol grip and forearm, and lastly 10-12 from the US made magazine--Body, follower and floorplate. The Type M rifle was purchased new to build this set and after Bullpup/922 build, 50 rounds were put downrange flawlessly! So buy with confidence in this practically new weapon. This is a perfect urban weapon system and would be a blast anywhere it is needed, be it fun or defense. A picture speaks a 1000 words so have a look and l will answer any questions regarding the Rifle. Legalese:
Oregon residents can buy FTF with ID, and sign Bill of Sale declaring legal ability to own/buy a firearm. All others know your laws before asking to buy. I will ship to FFL only and shipping will be actual cost on your end, should be around $40 or so. Thanks for looking!
$875  Will be sold sooner than later as it is up for bid on Gunbroker.com and no trades at this time. Thanks for looking!

The MK11 first stage's streamline body is constructed of machined marine-grade chrome. The MK11 has a balanced diaphragm to offer you peace of mind with its smooth breathing mechanisms and maximum performance that don't diminish as your tank's air pressure changes. This first stage is available with a DIN or yoke configuration, making it ideal for divers around the globe. This first stage comes standard with the Thermal Insulating System (TIS), which keeps your first stage from freezing up and malfunctioning in cold water conditions. Additionally, its over-balanced diaphragm first stage design gives you better breathing performance at greater depths. 
The S555's air-balanced flow valve allows you to breathe easily and steadily throughout your dive, regardless of the air pressure within your tank. Without this feature, your breathing may change as your tank empties, leaving you working harder to fill your lungs as your dive progresses. The S555 is resistant to corrosion, which gives it a long lifespan and makes it an excellent value. The manufacturing and materials used to create this second stage make it a great choice for cold-water divers.
